title: Digital Academy

details.body:
Who we are

The Digital Academy’s purpose is to transform the way government designs services for its users. It provides learning and experience that enable graduates to work on agile digital development projects, building services to meet users’ needs.

Founded by the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) in 2014, the Digital Academy will become part of the Government Digital Service (GDS) by early 2017 to offer digital training to government.

Courses

The Digital Academy provides training in these areas:

  • digital foundation course
  • digital and agile awareness
  • agile for teams
  • hands on agile for leaders
  • foundation academy for business analysts
  • foundation academy for delivery managers
  • foundation academy for product owners
  • foundation academy for service managers

For more information download the Digital Academy course prospectus 2016 (PDF, 762KB, 18 pages) .

Locations

Digital academy courses take place in:

  • Fulham (London)
  • Leeds
  • Stockport (Manchester)
  • Washington (Sunderland)

Courses may be offered in other locations if there’s sufficient demand.

How to book

Contact digital.academy@dwp.gsi.gov.uk for further information on:

  • current course availability
  • how to book a place
  • existing course bookings

Contact

Contact digital.academy@dwp.gsi.gov.uk with any questions about the Digital Academy.

Contact the Digital, Data and Technology Profession for information about other cross government learning and development programmes.
